Ukrainian UAVs are flying to Moscow Oblast for the third night in a row. Airports have once again begun to close, with strategic bombers and tactical aircraft being evacuated.
Ukrainian UAVs are flying to Moscow Oblast for the third night in a row. Airports have once again begun to close, with strategic bombers and tactical aircraft being evacuated.

By the way, I think I should mention that when Russia carries out its next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine this week, it is not in response to Ukraine's drone attacks on Moscow.
Russian preparations for this attack were delayed due to their scheduled nuclear exercises. But the attack date is largely set in stone and was planned well in advance of Ukraine beginning their attacks. Russia doesn't really do "retaliatory strikes". 
The individual Iskander-M strikes are usually opportunistic, targeting something which has just been discovered, while the larger, more coordinated attacks are planned beforehand, targeting static targets such as Ukraine's energy infrastructure, their military-industrial complex, and airfields.

Take notes Ukraine
Ukrainian channel on Ukraine's recent counterattacks in the Dobropillya direction.

Due to the Belgorod Reservoir Dam breach, the water level downstream towards Russian positions in the Vovchansk direction has begun to rise, flooding additional areas. 
Behind the dam, the water level has receded multiple meters, with attempts underway to slow down the flow.

Due to the Belgorod Reservoir Dam breach, the water level downstream towards Russian positions in the Vovchansk direction has begun to rise, flooding additional areas. 
Behind the dam, the water level has receded multiple meters, with attempts underway to slow down the flow.

Russian forces have captured the village of Pryvilne, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~23.
Total land area: ~0.65 km¬≤.

In the Hulyaipole direction, Russian forces continued to advance west of the Yanchur River and have made further progress in the fields west of Poltavka.
Russian forces continued pushing west down the treelines from positions west of Poltavka, establishing control over new areas at the base of the next set of tactical heights. They also secured treelines positions on the flanks from the north and south, levelling the frontline, and allowing for future development of the offensive towards the Vesele-Novouspenivske line. 
+ ~4.07 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Hulyaipole and Pokrovske directions, Russian forces continued their offensive operations, advancing in several different areas.
In the south, Russian forces expanded their bridgehead on the western bank of the Yanchur River. After establishing control over the northern part of Zlahoda, Russian soldiers immediately began clearing the rest of the village, establishing full control over it. Shortly afterwards, they levelled the frontline to the east, and crossed a tributary of the river, linking up with assault groups attacking from west of Novohryhorivka. 
To the northwest, the Russians crossed the Yanchur River at a new point, infiltrating through the forested areas to the southern houses of Yehorivka, where they were able to consolidate. Other forces advanced uphill down a treeline south of Yehorivka, while DRGs penetrated multiple kilometres further west.
To the northeast, Russian forces continued approaching Vyshneve from the southeast. They captured the rest of the treeline leading to the village and entered the agricultural complex after heavily bombing it with FABs and artillery. They also entered the eastern houses of the village and began advancing towards the centre. Other forces crossed a tributary of the Yanchur River from eastern Vyshneve and advanced up two parallel treelines, infiltrating the southern part of Novooleksandrivka. 
Further northeast, Russian forces advanced from central Novoselivka into the southern part, completing the capture of the village. They also established control over the rest of the treelines to the south.
+ ~16.66 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Hulyaipole and Pokrovske directions, Russian forces continued their offensive operations, advancing in several different areas.  In the south, Russian forces expanded their bridgehead on the western bank of the Yanchur River. After establishing control‚Ä¶

As a result of these recent Russian advances, and the breaching of the Ukrainian defences west of the Yanchur River, forward Russian units are now within 4.3 km of the critical Pokrovsk'e - Hulyaipole Highway. 
Once cut, logistics into Hulyaipole will become very difficult as the only other road is less than 6 km from the frontline. I previously talked about Russia's goals to capture Hulyaipole at the beginning of September. Since then, they have advanced over 19 km westwards, with the Ukrainians being unable to stop the advance due to their critical manpower shortages in this sector.

In the Novopavlivka direction, Russian forces advanced to the Dnipropetrovsk - Donetsk Regional Border, establishing control over an important stronghold.
Russian forces advanced from the western part of Novoserhiivka and entered a large trench stronghold and bunker system. Soldiers were able to clear it, detonating the concrete bunkers with explosives and engaging the remaining Ukrainian soldiers with small arms. Other forces captured new positions in the treelines to the north, largely aligning the front with the regional border.
+ ~3.04 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued to advance in and around Pokrovsk, capturing key positions within the city.
In the west, after bombing Ukrainian positions with FABs, Russian forces advanced from the treelines west of Pokrovsk to the railway line, establishing control over a 2.9 km stretch of the railway windbreaks. 
In Pokrovsk City, Russian forces were able to consolidate in the northern part of the Sobachivka District, as well as the eastern part of the city centre. Clashes continue in the area of the railway station, administrative building, city council building, and other nearby districts. 
From there, the Russians crossed the railway line and entrenched in the private sector, establishing a wedge between the two industrial strongholds in northern Pokrovsk. They then advanced further, capturing positions on Bereznya and Demury Streets, with DRGs infiltrating even further north. Additionally, Russian forces infiltrated further into the northwestern industrial zone of Pokrovsk, expanding the grey zone further.
+ ~1.87 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Pokrovsk direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations in Myrnohrad, and have made significant progress in the southern part of the city. 
After entering the city further north and securing the areas to the east, Russian forces infiltrated the southern suburbs of Myrnohrad in multiple new places, consolidating in the first streets. Reinforcements were then sent in, allowing for additional progress to be made on a wide front. 
Russian forces reached the terykon from the east, establishing control over Mine 5/6, and began bypassing the terykon from the south into the nearby residential streets. Other forces who entered further south captured the small private sector and advanced towards one of the city parks, linking up with other formations. 
+ ~1.91 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

On the northeastern flank of Pokrovsk, Russian forces continued to advance behind Pokrovsk and established full control over the city of Rodynske. 
After infiltrating the city from the south, and advancing from the east and north, the remaining Ukrainian units were forced to leave the city, allowing for the Russians to capture the rest of the city centre and western suburbs. They then went on to establish control over the railway line to the west, along with the abandoned and demolished mine. 
To the southeast, Russian forces continued to advance north of Myrnohrad, and captured additional treeline positions north of the city as well as an abandoned mineshaft. Some soldiers were able to infiltrate the northern streets of the city; however no consolidation has occurred yet. 
+ ~3.68 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Dobropillya direction, both Russian and Ukrainian forces are advancing, with Ukrainian forces making substantial progress on the western flank of the salient.
In the south, Ukrainian forces advanced from their positions east of the railway line and recaptured treeline positions north of Zatyshok. They then infiltrated the village from the north, and attempted to push towards its western edge, resulting in Russian and Ukrainian positions being mixed up in a grey zone. Other forces also infiltrated Sukhetske, however there is no evidence of consolidation yet. 
To the north, the Ukrainians once again recaptured the village of Nove Shakhove, and established control over positions to the south. They also advanced from Vilne to the treelines south and southeast and recaptured the dachas to the east. 
To the northeast, Ukrainian forces advanced from their newly established positions in Kucheriv Yar, capturing positions in the forest plantations to the south. 
Meanwhile, Russian forces continued to advance in western Shakhove amid fierce fighting, and established full control over that section of the village. Mechanised assaults were also carried out on the eastern part of the village, however there is no evidence of consolidation yet. 
+ ~13.99 km in favour of Ukraine.
+ ~0.52 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Kostyantynivka direction, Russian forces closed the pocket south of the reservoir and began refocusing their efforts further north.
Following the earlier Ukrainian withdrawal from the cut-off area south of the Kleban-Bykske reservoir via rubber boats, Russian forces have now established control over the treelines and forests to the south. Since then, they have continued their attacks towards the rear of the reservoir and are attempting to gain a foothold in the forests east of the highway.
+ ~12.40 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Siversk direction, Russian forces resumed their assault operations towards Siversk from the southeast and have captured new positions on the tactical heights.
Russian forces advanced from the treelines northeast of Vyimka, pushing along the tactical heights, and captured new positions to the northwest. They then advanced further north up a treeline and are attempting to establish control over additional positions closer to Siversk. 
+ ~2.52 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued their offensive operations and have made new progress to east of the city. 
In the northwest, Russian forces advanced further through the forests along the railway line and reached the eastern edge of Lyman. DRGs then infiltrated the city and have since been operating in the area of the freight terminals. They also established control over new parts of the forests and infiltrated further into the Masliakivka District. 
To the southeast, Russian forces continued to slowly advance in Yampil. They were able to advance out of the village centre and capture some new positions in the southwestern streets. Ukrainian forces are gradually being pushed back to the southwestern edge of the settlement. 
+ ~3.70 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

In the Lyman direction, Russian forces continued to expand their zone of control west of Zarichne, and have eliminated the salient recently formed there.
After outflanking Ukrainian strongpoints west of Zarichne from the north, Ukrainian forces began withdrawing to the west to prevent being encircled. The Russians have since captured the agricultural complex that served as one of Ukraine's main forward deployment points in this sector, and secured the rest of the surrounding forests, levelling the frontline to the west. 
+ ~3.85 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

Al-Suwayda Druze Leader Demands ‚ÄòIndependence‚Äô From Syria, Laying Ground For Israeli Invasion
The spiritual leader of the Druze community in Syria, Hikmat al-Hajri, said on October 27 that self-determination for the people of al-Suwayda is ‚Äúan absolute right that cannot be revoked‚Äù, stressing that his vision is based on the ‚Äúcomplete independence‚Äù of the governorate.
Druze armed factions backed the Islamist rebel offensive that overthrew the regime of former President Bashar al-Assad last December, but later refused to allow the forces of the country‚Äôs new Islamist-led Interim Government to enter al-Suwayda, maintaining a form of autonomy over the governorate.
In July a battle broke out in al-Suwayda, when an intervention by government forces to end a local conflict involving bedouins quickly escalated into an all-out, sectarian-fueled attack on the Druze. Israel, which vowed to protect the community after the fall of the Assad regime, eventually intervened...

In Video: New Russian Automated Gun Takes Down Ukrainian Drones
The Russian military began fielding a deeply modernized drone hunter version of the ZU-23-2 23 mm twin-barreled autocannon, which was developed by the Soviet Union in the 1950s.
On October 27, video footage of one such autocannon engaging several Ukrainian long-range, fixed-wing drones surfaced online. It is unclear when or where exactly the footage was taken, but it clearly shows the autocannon taking down at least four drones.
The autocannon is likely based on the same system shown to Dmitry Medvedev, Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia, during his recent visit to the Kapustin Yar test site.

INTENSITY PEAKS ON KEY FRONTS AS KHARKIV CRISIS THREAT GROWS

Russia Continues Strikes On Ukraine‚Äôs Energy And Transport Sectors, While The EU Faces Challenges In Supporting Kyiv
In recent days, Russia and Ukraine have continued exchanging strikes, targeting each other's key infrastructure. The Russian armed forces have concentrated their primary efforts on Ukraine's energy facilities, including wind farms, as well as transport infrastructure‚Äîspecifically, railway trains used for transporting military equipment and weapons to the front lines. In turn, Ukraine once again targeted a dam in the Belgorod region and carried out a drone raid on Moscow.
The use of new types of glide bombs with record-breaking range for this class of munition by Russian aviation has sharply increased the destructive force of massive air raids on rear-area targets and placed an additional burden on Ukraine's already depleted forces.

Ukraine Faces Failure In Zaporizhzhia: Clearing Operations Along Yangchur River Near Completion
Ukrainian special operations units have been urgently redeployed to Pokrovsk. They are now approximately 3 kilometers from reaching the key Pokrovsk-Huliaipole highway. Control of the Privolnoye and Novonikolayevka settlements in the Zaporizhzhia sector has been established. 
Meanwhile, Polish President Karol Nawrocki has declined an invitation to visit Ukraine.

Trump‚Äôs Bail Out Of Argentina Backfiring: Washington‚Äôs Attempt To Buy Loyalty To Counter Brazil
Trump‚Äôs $20 billion rescue for Argentina and increased beef imports have sparked domestic backlash among US farmers. It is about securing Argentina as a US ally, amid Milei‚Äôs NATO ambitions, as part of a strategy to ‚Äúcounter‚Äù BRICS, Brazil and Chinese presence in the hemisphere.

Syrian Government Forces Attack Al-Suwayda With Drones After Calls For Independence (Videos) 
The forces of Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government launched late on October 27 a series of drone strikes against Druze fighters in al-Suwayda, in a violation of a ceasefire in the southern governorate brokered by the United States.
The latest drone strikes targeted positions in the western outskirts of al-Suwayda city. At least ten people were reportedly wounded including members of the National Guard, a unified group formed by Druze armed factions following the battle with government forces.
On the very next day, a bus carrying Druze civilians from al-Suwayda to Damascus came under attack in a part of the highway that is supposedly secured by government forces. Two people were killed and at least 11 others were wounded as a result of the attack.
